edu.wpi.first.wpilibj

Interface CANSpeedController

  • All Superinterfaces:
    LiveWindowSendable, PIDInterface, PIDOutput, Sendable, SpeedController

    public interface CANSpeedController
extends SpeedController, PIDInterface, LiveWindowSendable

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static interface  CANSpeedController.ControlMode
      Mode determines how the motor is controlled, used internally.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static String SMART_DASHBOARD_TYPE
      All CAN Speed Controllers have the same SmartDashboard type: "CANSpeedController".

      • setD

        void setD(double d)
        Set the derivative PID constant.

      • setF

        default void setF(double f)
        Set the feed-forward PID constant. This method is optional to implement.

      • getF

        default double getF()
        Gets the feed-forward PID constant. This method is optional to implement. If a subclass does not implement this, it will always return zero.

      • getBusVoltage

        double getBusVoltage()
        Get the current input (battery) voltage.
        Returns:
        the input voltage to the controller (in Volts).

      • getOutputVoltage

        double getOutputVoltage()
        Get the current output voltage.
        Returns:
        the output voltage to the motor in volts.

      • getOutputCurrent

        double getOutputCurrent()
        Get the current being applied to the motor.
        Returns:
        the current motor current (in Amperes).

      • getTemperature

        double getTemperature()
        Get the current temperature of the controller.
        Returns:
        the current temperature of the controller, in degrees Celsius.

      • getPosition

        double getPosition()
        Return the current position of whatever the current selected sensor is.

        See specific implementations for more information on selecting feedback sensors.

        Returns:
        the current sensor position.

      • getSpeed

        double getSpeed()
        Return the current velocity of whatever the current selected sensor is.

        See specific implementations for more information on selecting feedback sensors.

        Returns:
        the current sensor velocity.

      • setVoltageRampRate

        void setVoltageRampRate(double rampRate)
        Set the maximum rate of change of the output voltage.
        Parameters:
        rampRate - the maximum rate of change of the votlage, in Volts / sec.
